data.sentence: The word وَمِنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: to do evil, be ill natured, wicked. yashirru/yasharru - to find fault, defame. sharrun (pl. ashrar) - evil, bad, wicked, vicious ones. It is noteable that shurrun is an exceptional form of elative adjective while the measure for elative in Arabic is afa'la. shararun (pl. ashraar) - sparks of fire.
data.sentence: The word شَرِّ comes from the root ش ر ر and is associated with the meanings: to do evil, be ill natured, wicked. yashirru/yasharru - to find fault, defame. sharrun (pl. ashrar) - evil, bad, wicked, vicious ones. It is noteable that shurrun is an exceptional form of elative adjective while the measure for elative in Arabic is afa'la. shararun (pl. ashraar) - sparks of fire.
The word حَاسِدٍ comes from the root ح س د and is associated with the meanings: To envy, grudge.
The word حَسَدَ comes from the root ح س د and is associated with the meanings: To envy, grudge.
